page.title: 05Local History - Fort
page.content: At the south end of Felixstowe over looking the harbour is the largest port for containers in the UK. On a narrow peninsula of shingle protecting the harbour entrance there is a 16th C.fort Landguard Fort is worth a visit. It was built in 1534 and rebuilt in the 18th C The land round the fort gives a good view of the sea. This is a listed monument under the protection of the D. of the Environment.Across the Orwell estuary is Harwich. The original Domes day survey called this peninsula Long- stone and in 1534 it was Langerston. Today we call it Landguard Point.The fort houses a museum, opened in 1985, in the Ravelin Block, built in 1878. It is opened on Sunday afternoons by Felixstowe History & Museum Society. There are 4 rooms about the floods of 1953, soldiers since 1534, relics of the World War and general local history
